title: RNG might fk you up but it'll never...
body: Fk you up so bad that you can't beat the shitters who complain about RNG giving them 8th place

replies.body: It will never give you up. It will never let you down.

This post is entirely wrong.  While I don't agree with most of those complaining about RNG issues, matchmaking matches you with players who are as equal to your skill level as possible, which means in any given game, someone who is statistically just as skilled as someone else is going to end up in 8th place while the other person ends up not in 8th place.

I mean.... I'm not bad at TFT, Usually there are things you can do with RNG that prevent you from being 8th.... but eventually you get to a point where everyone knows the same shit you do and no matter what you do, 8th place is a realistic finish. It's frustrating knowing that because you got 0 items from PVE you have no chance against the minimum 4 guys who got good RNG. Then the game makes you face them multiple times and you just pray that somehow you get that special 2nd level carry that you've been looking for xD

You are assuming big skillgaps, but if the skill is equal, who is going to win? And yes I agree that people who complain about luck are easy to beat as they usually do not look at what they could do better but just excuse their failure by bad luck, but the difference in items gets more and more obvious the higher you get on ladder as those people are actually your equals in skill and any advantage will push them above you. Maybe it will not result in ending 8th, but you pretty much know you are going to be happy for top4 finish when people have more items and they allocate them well.
Cool story bruh. I love your assessment based off a limited comment on a forum board ;) You're clearly a genius.

Right okay.... getting stomped by the guy in first place who has all the item/unit advantage 4 times in a row isn't RNG? Nor is it RNG when you are just before wolves and you have a full bench of 1 cost units which you haven't been able to upgrade to tier 2.

Bottom line, RNG can give you automatic 8th place, it's rare but it happens.
Once I got shit enough luck I got 8th place, but it's pretty rare for that to happen. If you're consistently getting fuck *that* hard by RNG you need to change your strategy.
